TopicTitle: KSP RP forum server CPU usage exceeded.

Articles.Content: Kinda-sorta. We still don\'t have stuff like GM point values, and the forum continues to go up and down.
On the bright side, the nation posts are becoming more like nation posts!

My nation post is already pretty much completed :3

In semi-related news, my nation\'s anthem is the song from KSP\'s credits. Because Lunus is awesome like that.

> 
> My nation post is already pretty much completed :3
> 
> In semi-related news, my nation\'s anthem is the song from KSP\'s credits. Because Lunus is awesome like that.

Lucky.

I really should get a real anthem up, and not just a horrible chant.

i cant do the test for 2 ressons

1. microsoft office had buggered up on me

2.i am freeking out due to my end of ks3 exams ![:o](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_ohmy.png) :o ![:o](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_ohmy.png)

so asked im the apply thing for a deal

membership now=do test later when i can

> i cant do the test for 2 ressons
> 
> 1. microsoft office had buggered up on me
> 
> 2.i am freeking out due to my end of ks3 exams ![:o](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_ohmy.png) :o ![:o](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_ohmy.png)
>

> 
> membership now=do test later when i can

How about no? You need to do the test to get membership. And what is ks3?

That isn\'t how it works, popeter. You have your cause and effect mixed up.

Test first, then RP. I did it whilst doing my GCSEs.

EDIT

@Lordwasteland, \'KS3\' is Key Stage 3\'. Around year 7 to year 9 in UK secondary schools.

> 
> How about no? You need to do the test to get membership. And what is ks3?

ks3=key stage 3 =british years 7-9

> 
> That isn\'t how it works, popeter. You have your cause and effect mixed up.
> 
> Test first, then RP. I did it whilst doing my GCSEs.
>

> 
> @Lordwasteland, \'KS3\' is Key Stage 3\'. Around year 7 to year 9 in UK secondary schools.

...And to be honest I should actually be revising for my end of KS3 science exam, which is tomorrow, and which I haven\'t revised for much, instead of sitting here and typing this.
Ah... as an American, I didn\'t know that. Anyone get access to the site?

> 
> Anyone get access to the site?

 As with all the \'outages\' of this site before, it still works on my kindle, for no readily apparent reason. There were a few people who could get on with normal home connections in the last outages as well, including one using the same internet package as me. Anyone have any idea why this could be happening?
I keep getting a connection error, now. Very odd.

> 
> I keep getting a connection error, now. Very odd.

I was getting that a while back, the only way I could get around it was to use Tor..

> 
> I was getting that a while back, the only way I could get around it was to use Tor..

Tor? I use Opera, gonna check if it works on Firefox.
Tor\'s not a browser, it\'s a form of proxy service. Switching browsers hasn\'t worked for anybody, as far as I\'ve found.

i can get on it

firefox use i(yoda)
IE9, Virgin Media. Repeated \'Commlu.com is not responding, recover webpage?\', but no loss of connection to site as such.

> 
> i can get on it
> 
> firefox use i(yoda)

Not how to talk like Yoda, that is.

'On it, I can get.

Firefox, I use.'
Amazing isn\'t it? The topic has circulated entirely, and now, on page 30, it is relevant to the topic name again.
thing is the cpu has not exceeded
I think all the science talk has robbed people here of a sense of humour.
I laughed.

>

Damn right it has.
Not down for everyone, at least.

Welp, it\'s completely down for me now.

I\'ve finished compiling a large informational map, so maybe i will be able to get a thread up if my access returns.
